intro: Byttneria oranensis, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its hard, durable wood, it has been historically valued for timber and traditional uses.
